question:
In January, the exchange rate between the South Korean won and the US dollar was <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi>
      <mspace width="thickmathspace"></mspace>
      <mn>1</mn>
      <mo>,</mo>
      <mn>100</mn>
      <mo>=</mo>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">U</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi>
      <mspace width="thickmathspace"></mspace>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\rm{KWN\;1,100 = USD\;1}}</annotation></semantics></math>. Three months later, the exchange rate was <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">W</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi>
      <mspace width="thickmathspace"></mspace>
      <mn>1</mn>
      <mo>,</mo>
      <mn>200</mn>
      <mo>=</mo>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">U</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi>
      <mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi>
      <mspace width="thickmathspace"></mspace>
      <mn>1</mn>
    </mrow>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{\rm{KWN\;1,200 = USD\;1}}</annotation></semantics></math>. This means that ________.

answers.text: it will cost US companies more to purchase raw materials from South Korea
it will cost Korean companies more to purchase raw materials from the United States
US companies that sell their products in South Korea will find their revenue has increased
Korean companies that sell their products in the United States will find that their revenue has decreased
